org.twdata.kokua.signal
Class MessageBus

java.lang.Object
  org.twdata.kokua.signal.MessageBus

public class MessageBus
extends java.lang.Object

WERX - Java Swing RAD Framework Copyright 2003 Bradlee Johnson Released under LGPL license The MessageBus is the heart of the framework. Objects "plug in" to the bus. At that point reflection determines what channels the object is listening on and registers it on those channels. When a signal is propagated on that channel, all the objects on that channel are notified. The MessageBus is a wrapper around a standard bus object. The bus object is used in other subpackages that themseleves plug into this bus. I effect creating a bus of buses. Imporant to note: channels are defined by message name parameters. For example, an object listening for an AddJInternalFrameSignal would have a channel(AddJInternalFrameSignal) on it in order to receive that signal. The rest is automatic.

Version:
Final Release 1.0
Author:
Bradlee Johnson

public void unplug(java.lang.Object aComponent)
Unplug method to remove an object from the bus.

Parameters:
aComponent - The object to be removed from bus channels.

plug

public void plug(java.lang.Object aComponent)
plug method to plug objects into bus channels. This uses reflection to figure out which channels the object is listenting on. Any object with a method starting with channelPrefix is added to that channel.

Parameters:
aComponent - The object to plug into the bus

resetbus

public void resetbus()
resetbus () Notifies the bus to get rid of all channels.
